intro: Ribes longeracemosum var. longeracemosum, commonly known as the long-stemmed gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Grossulariaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ornamental and edible purposes.
